text: I am trying to track custom behavior events on my react application.  Tracking code is properly sending data about page views, so I know that works.  I created custom behavior event in my dashboard and now I am trying to implement the code.  How can I confirm that the data is being sent?  Would it be in the contacts logs or would it only be in the "custom behavioral events" section of data management?

Hello everyone,
I'm looking for an API that we can use to send notifications from a Laravel application to HubSpot. These notifications would then trigger HubSpot to send emails to the contacts selected in the sent notification
I am using the PHP API in my Laravel project, however, I am running into issues with it - <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/overview>
You can add contacts to a list and then setup a workflow to send the emails

Hello everyone,
I'm looking for an API that we can use to send notifications from a Laravel application to HubSpot. These notifications would then trigger HubSpot to send emails to the contacts selected in the sent notification

Where do I get this information for my account access token?

`" --header 'authorization: Bearer YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN' \"`
You have to create a public app and make a Oauth flow on your side or make a private app and copy your acces token.

I am trying to use this endpoint
```/settings/v3/users/roles ```
which is the second one on this page:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/settings/user-provisioning>

When I use the Private app access token that works for the other endpoints on the page, I get this response:
```HTTP 400

{
  "status": "error",
  "message": "Account doesn't have access to roles.",
  "correlationId": "6d8f5813-d9ec-4448-8dc5-96867afedbe0",
  "category": "VALIDATION_ERROR"
}```
When I follow along with this tutorial video:
<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x-trhs4GJTc&t=689s>

 This is my inputs:

When I click "Get New Access Token", a window pops up, saying the page is nowhere to be found. And then the modal eventually shows that the authentication failed.

For context, I am a Super Admin of my HubSpot account. <@U01QVR44MEY> do you know what I might be doing wrong? Thank you in advance for all insight
Here is the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/timeline|official documentation> for the CRM Timeline with some examples on how to get that setup
<@U05MS0X62D7> Your third screenshot has part of your access token visible, I'd recommend removing that screenshot
is there a way to use the apis chatspot is using like <https://app.HubSpot.com/api/chatspot/v1/api/chat> ?
what subscription level is your HubSpot account?  I believe (and I am just going off memory) but roles is an enterprise feature.
We have the step below the Enterprise level (Professional I believe). When I talked to support, they thought that using a developer account would help me get around that
Is that correct?
are you trying this with a test portal set up in a developer acct?
(i know it is confusing)
the portal (HubSpot acct) that you want this to work in will need to have the correct tier
test accts _should_  have that functionality, but you would not be able to employ that on a prod acct without the correct tier

Ok I think I might have gotten it to work. Turns out I had not created the Private app in the developer account; thank you for walking me through that. Just to confirm, with this developer account, when I use the endpoint tests on this page

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/settings/user-provisioning>

the results should all be empty because I have not put anything into it?
i believe so
again.  from memory :sweat_smile:
Awesome! thank you so much

take over
i need to go do a presentation :laughing:

oh thats cool, good luck Dennis! Unfortunately I won't be able to make it but I am grateful for the help!
That token is expired already .
